citeinfo.origin: National Snow and Ice Data Center (NSIDC)
citeinfo.title: Arctic Ice Dynamics Joint Experiment - Camp Data

descript.abstract: During summer 1975, the Arctic Ice Dynamics Joint Experiment (AIDJEX) maintained 4 manned camps on ice floes in the Arctic Ocean. Instrumentation recorded surface and geostrophic winds, ocean current velocity at 2 and 30 meter depths, and camp (floe) position. Data available are daily average values for each parameter at each camp, as well as ice velocity and smoothed position data. Surface pressure and geostrophic wind data at 6-hourly intervals are also available.
descript.purpose: To obtain data on instrumentation recorded surface and geostrophic winds, ocean current velocity at 2 and 30 meter depths, and camp (floe) position.

idinfo.useconst: There are no restrictions on the distribution of this data.

distinfo.distliab: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system. NOAA makes no warranty, expressed or implied, nor does the fact of distribution constitute such a warranty.

metainfo.metuc: There are no restrictions on the distribution of this data.
